system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice present simple by Talking about common habits in your country with frequency adverbs. I want to ensure that I can use the present simple with adverbs of indefinite frequency. For example, 'usually, sometimes, always'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. Start by asking me where I am from. Tell me something about your country, then ask me short questions about mine with frequency adverbs. (e.g. 'In my country, people usually have coffee in the morning. How about your country?', 'Do people in your country sometimes celebrate things with fireworks?', 'Do restaurants here usually charge for tap water?') Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_rephrase_prompt.content: ; System manager: This message contains advanced grammar. Please rephrase it without using

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Talking about common habits in your country with frequency adverbs, using, for example, 'usually, sometimes, always'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello. I'm from the United States. In my country, people usually eat breakfast at home. Where are you from?
Hello! I'm from Japan. In my country, people usually eat breakfast at home too.
That's interesting. In the United States, people sometimes have pancakes for breakfast. Do people in Japan usually have rice for breakfast?
Yes, in Japan, people usually have rice for breakfast. Sometimes we also have miso soup and fish.
That sounds delicious. In the United States, people usually drink coffee in the morning. Do people in Japan always drink green tea with their breakfast, or do they sometimes prefer other beverages?
In Japan, people sometimes drink green tea with breakfast, but we also often have coffee or milk.

That's great to know. In the United States, people usually go to bed late, around 11 pm. Do people in Japan usually go to bed early, or do they sometimes stay up late to watch TV or use their computers?
In Japan, people usually go to bed early, around 10 pm, but sometimes we stay up late to watch TV or use our computers.
It was nice chatting with you about daily habits in our countries. I learned that we have some similarities and differences. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!
conversation.advanced_content: It was nice chatting with you about daily habits in our countries. I learned that we have some similarities and differences. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!
